snippet: Scott M. Stringer’s rival criticized him for not attending a pension board’s meetings and questioned whether Mr. Stringer still owned his own soul after a 20-year career in politics.
abstract: Scott M Stringer, Democratic candidate for New York City comptroller, engages in first general election debate with Republican rival John Burnett; Burnett lashes out at Stringer for not attending meetings of a pension board on which he sits and accuses him of not understanding financial terms; Stringer questions Burnett about continuing government shutdown and looming debt crisis.
lead_paragraph: Scott M. Stringer’s rival criticized him for not attending a pension board’s meetings and questioned whether Mr. Stringer still owned his own soul after a 20-year career in politics.

headline.main: Candidates Spar Over Souls and Pensions in Comptroller Debate
headline.print_headline: Candidates Spar Over Souls and Pensions in Comptroller Debate
